articles.description: Marcus Rashford's birthday celebrations after Manchester United's 3-0 derby defeat were "unacceptable" and the forward has apologised, says Erik ten Hag.
articles.title: Rashford birthday party 'unacceptable' - Ten Hag

articles.description: Leeds United end Leicester City's nine-game winning run in the Championship with an impressive victory at the King Power Stadium.
articles.title: Leicester winning run ended by impressive Leeds

articles.description: Red Bull’s Max Verstappen beat Ferrari’s Charles Leclerc to pole position in a rain-affected qualifying session at the Sao Paulo Grand Prix.
articles.title: Verstappen takes pole in rain-affected qualifying

articles.description: Chelsea boss Emma Hayes says she is "proud" of midfielder Fran Kirby for speaking out on body image issues in women's football.
articles.title: Hayes 'proud' of Kirby for speaking out on body image

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola dismisses Roy Keane's claim that his on-pitch conversations with players is "all for show".
articles.title: Guardiola denies claim player talks are 'for show'

articles.description: James Bessey-Saldanha scores in "magical moment" to give Sheppey United 1-0 lead over Walsall.
articles.title: Sheppey United take lead over Walsall with 'magical' goal

articles.description: Novak Djokovic continues his bid for a record-extending seventh Paris Masters title by beating Holger Rune to reach the semi-finals.
articles.title: Djokovic beats Rune to reach semi-finals in Paris

articles.description: Sale Sharks go top of the Premiership by beating Gloucester as England fly-half George Ford and captain Ben Curry return for the hosts.
articles.title: Ford and Curry return as Sale beat Gloucester

articles.description: Newcastle do not know if AC Milan were aware of the gambling charges facing Sandro Tonali when they sold him to the Magpies, says Dan Ashworth.
articles.title: Newcastle unsure if Milan knew about Tonali charges

articles.description: Afghanistan continue their late surge for a place in the World Cup semi-finals with a seven-wicket win over the Netherlands in Lucknow.
articles.title: Afghanistan beat Dutch to boost semi-final hopes
